item.title: Bricks and Mortar Apocolypse, Now?
item.description:
The physical world is struggling while the virtual world thrives. We may be approaching a point where the internet becomes dominant, and traditional businesses may suffer for unexpected reasons. Retail has been declining, but recently, there’s been a sharp downturn due to rising gas prices. This discourages driving, which leads to less shopping. Shopping is crucial for the economy; a decline in shopping could lead to an economic depression. Our society relies heavily on driving...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/bricks-and-mortar-apocolypse-now/
